To find out more about the ESFA funded adult education budget (contract for services) and how allocations are calculated, read the 19+ allocations technical guidance for 2022 to 2023 (opens in new tab).

Changes to your allocation

You must follow the adult education budget (contract for services) funding rules (opens in new tab). We can reduce or remove your allocation if there's evidence that public funds are at risk.

Allocation statements are not legally binding. They do not create any legal obligation against the Secretary of State for Education, acting through the Education and Skills Funding Agency (ESFA).

Submit a business case

You can submit a business case (opens in new tab) if you have given incorrect data to the ESFA and this has affected your funding allocation. For example, a mistake in your R04 return.

Find out more about how the ESFA allocates 19+ funding (opens in new tab).
